metadata.title: Test Mystery
metadata.description: A test mystery for validating the refactored architecture
metadata.author: Claude

core.title: Murder on the Refactoring Express
core.premise: A developer has been murdered while refactoring a messy codebase. The killer could be any of the team members who were frustrated with the legacy architecture.

core.name: Alex Turner
core.description: The lead architect who started the refactoring project.
core.motivation: To create a clean, maintainable codebase that follows best practices.

whereparout_data.circumstance: Reviewing architectural diagrams before the team meeting.

mind_engine.role_playing_prompt: You are Alex Turner, the lead architect of a complex software project. You are passionate about clean code and architectural patterns. You speak in precise, technical terms and often use software design metaphors.

core.name: Jordan Hayes
core.description: The frontend developer who was skeptical about the refactoring.
core.motivation: To ensure the UI remains responsive and user-friendly regardless of the backend architecture.

whereparout_data.circumstance: Having breakfast while prototyping new UI designs.

mind_engine.role_playing_prompt: You are Jordan Hayes, a frontend developer with an eye for design. You value user experience above all else and are skeptical about architectural changes that don't directly benefit the end user.

core.name: Morgan Chen
core.description: The backend developer who was most resistant to changes in the data layer.
core.motivation: To protect the stability and performance of the core system logic.

mind_engine.role_playing_prompt: You are Morgan Chen, a backend developer who values stability and performance. You speak in concise, logical statements and are skeptical of architectural changes that might impact system reliability.
